textContent:
Wrong fit if: 
1. feel unseen, misunderstood, alone 
2. Don't have the tools 
3  Withhold truth, get in head, no hard convos
4. Dont feel enough, undervalue, deprioritize
5  Don't have fun together - adventure & play
6. Lack deep appreciation - taken for granted

Right fit if: 
1. feel seen, understood, connected 
2. have the right tools 
3. speak truth, have hard convos
4. feel enough: valued & prioritized 
5. have fun together - adventure & play
6. deeply appreciate - and are grateful 

Our relationship: 
1. feel unseen, misunderstood, alone 
2. Don't have the tools 
3. Withhold truth, get in head, no hard convos
4. Dont feel enough: undervalue, deprioritize
5. have fun together - adventure & play
6. Lack deep appreciation - taken for granted 

Feels overwhelming to be failing all the time while trying so hard to be the right partner for you. 

Our friendship
1. Don't need to be seen in whole self. Feel seen as co-parent, caregiving
2. Tools change. Less emotional support. More functional support. 
3. Hard convos have space and distance. But still hard 
4. Feel just fine being friends 
5. Have fun together - adventure & play
6. Appreciate the here and now, not needing or expecting bigger role 

It feels easier and like a relief to drop the expectations of trying so hard just be. 

It's hard when doing this feels like failing and risking losing the parts of our relationship that work. 

//

So what does this tell us about whether or not we are the right or wrong fit? Can become the right or wrong fit? What assets are we starting with based on this assessment? 

Maybe we are the wrong fit and our story wasnt meant to be for life. Maybe our story was meant to help us find ourselves, learn our needs and mature. In doing so, we haven't grown closer. We've grown apart. Now letting go and trusting our relationship will continue to be what it needs to be for us is our path

Maybe we are the right fit and need to continue fighting for each other, learning what we need and being courageous enough to vocalize and honor it in ourselves and each other. And in doing so our relationship will feel more natural and rooted

///////


1. Feeling unseen, misunderstood, lonely

I feel this way often and my coping mechanism is to just say that's the way it is so don't expect otherwise. But deep down I want to feel seen, understood and cheered on in how I approach life, especially bc I've never fit in and feel weird. Yes I work a lot but my goal has always been Ikigai where it's not just work. And I want to spend time there, challenging ideas thinking about possibilities, iterating on what's happening. This has always been a core part of me as expressed so long ago with convos in the car on the way up to 6 flags. Also sharing my ideas about raising Ben, ideas about moving to Brazil, etc etc. and more often than not I've felt these conversations become frustrating for you and for me, ultimately not feeling connected, seen or understood. I have started to accept that's bc we process things differently and at the root care about different things. Deep down you don't care about projects that change the world or business ideas or what have you. They have always been things that get in the way of what you do care about - being together with people you care about. So the more I push for what I want the more it seperates us. The more you push for what you want the less I feel I can be me, which leads to #2.

2. Don't have the emotional tools to make it work (and need to grow, mature, heal)

We've explored this a lot, especially with our deep dive into love languages and eneagram.
I'm doing so we identified how our own reactions are the oposite of what the other person needs. I have lacked the ability to listen with compassion. Ive either listened to rebuttle, help save you, or with empathy. In all three I haven't been able to validate your experience. It's easier when it's your experience. Its incredibly hard when it's caused by me. I internalize and criticize myself for causing you harm, for not being more aware, more capable. Or, I vhemetly disagree and start to blame or criticize you. I'm learning the skill to listen with compassion and can see this being continually developed. But sharing so much hurt it feels like it will never be a place where you can actually listen to me and my hurt, especially that which you've been involved in. I share and hurt you. I don't share and hurt you and vice versa. So what I've attributed this to is that deep down I don't feel safe to be vulnerable, like really vulnerable, and say what I really want or need. Thats my problem but the root cause I feel is bc I don't trust you and I don't trust myself to handle the consequences.
title: Relationships End Because
